adrFormatAddress: 45 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Long-running, no-frills gay bar with a jukebox & a pool table.

originalText.text:
Dear reader, although it pains me to say it, I have to give this rather dilapidated bar five stars.
Why? You ask, with a look of horror on your face.
Well… because at this place people actually TALK to each other.
I stumbled into here after a fancy evening on the Lower East Side and quickly met a number of gentlemen from all walks of life. Really fantastic stuff, it’s these sorts of meets that hold society together.
So, although this place had a crumbling ceiling, a toilet in desperate need of renovation and a forest of mold erupting on its shutters, I am afraid I have to give it a five.
Well done the Boiler Room! Although it would be nice if, next time, you accepted a $100 bill

NB: Drinks are very cheap here! Being only $18 for three rum and cokes - a bargain!

originalText.text: I was just going to leave a review to compliment the bartenders for dealing with a super busy and demanding crowd and read the above review. I've been sitting at this bar all night and witnessed the abuse that these bartenders took from some foolish girl and her family. The bartenders tried to keep their cool while being insulted and screamed at. I'm a bartender myself and know exactly how they felt. The customer was awful and entitles. These 2 guys handled the crowd and specifically that horrible girl and her horrible mother like professionals. Cheers to them!

originalText.text: I always have a great time at Boiler. One of the few gay spaces left where you can drop in, grab a drink, and strike up a conversation. David who usually works on Mondays is super sweet and engaging, brings a lot of energy, and helps bring people together.

text.text: I always have a great time at Boiler. One of the few gay spaces left where you can drop in, grab a drink, and strike up a conversation. David who usually works on Mondays is super sweet and engaging, brings a lot of energy, and helps bring people together.

originalText.text: This place is great during later evenings to night sharp, however, we went there during evening time and it has few people but bar tender was very friendly and funny. We had few drinks as pre game and played pool table. They had photo booth, outdoor seating and other playstations. Drinks are reasonably priced, however, CASH only bar.

We had few drinks as pre game and played pool table. They had photo booth, outdoor seating and other playstations. Drinks are reasonably priced, however, CASH only bar.

originalText.text: Me and my friends spent a lot of money at this place . We decided we wanted to pick some songs on the jukebox , the bartender then skipped 3 of the songs we paid for . When I asked him why he simply said “I don’t wanna listen to that” ….. like what ?? That’s not really your call . He called me the b word for asking for my songs to be played . Then called the cops on me and my friends . Never going here again hope the bar gets shut down . My first gay bar and as a lesbian I’ve never been talked to the way the bartender talked to me . Then he proceeded to tell the cops that they’re allowed to be rude to customers at the bar because it’s “different than other bars “ . Please tell be what bar allows their bartenders to call people such names for asking for what they paid for . I wouldn’t give 0 stars if I could . The sink was broken , the Photo Booth took $20 from me with no cash back . It’s not much to look at anyway . I’d recommend going anywhere but here .
